doc.after: The great auk was a food source for Neanderthals more than 100,000 years ago, as evidenced by well-cleaned bones found by their campfires.[30] Images believed to depict the great auk were also carved into the walls of the El Pendo Cave, Santander in Spain over 35,000 years ago,[52] while cave paintings 20,000 years old have been found in France's Grotte Cosquer.[13]
